item.description:
无论国际能源机构的预测如何，生产商都一心想从大陆架上榨取更多油桶。【原文：

Producers are intent on squeezing more barrels from the continental shelf regardless of International Energy Agency forecasts.

】

item.title: 澳大利亚利率震荡使澳大利亚央行的无线电沉默受到关注
item.description: 在澳大利亚央行周二做出利率决定之前的七周里，澳大利亚央行的政策制定者们一直保持沉默，因为中东的热战和美国的贸易战动摇了全球信心。【原文：In the seven weeks leading up to the Australian central bank interest rate decision Tuesday, its policymakers sat silent as hot wars in the Middle East and trade wars from the US shook global confidence.】

item.title: 电动汽车竞赛举步维艰，气候行动在优先事项清单上排名靠后
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日通讯。今天，Luz Ding 将关注 Formula E 在可持续发展和环保意识日益淡薄的大环境下的命运。此外，请订阅彭博社的《体育商业》时事通讯，了解权力、金钱与体育碰撞的背景。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. item.title: 特朗普关税警告信扰乱航运旺季
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一发布了第一轮贸易信函，为十多个国家设定了新税率，同时将 "对等 "关税的最后期限推迟到 8 月 1 日。【原文：President Donald Trump issued his first round of trade letters Monday, setting new rates for more than a dozen countries, while pushing back the deadline for “reciprocal” tariffs until Aug 1.】

item.title: 特朗普致全球的信威胁关税之痛
item.description: 我是克雷格-斯特林（Craig Stirling），法兰克福资深编辑。今天我们将关注唐纳德-特朗普的最新贸易大炮。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Craig Stirling, a senior editor in Frankfurt. Today we’re looking at Donald Trump’s latest trade salvos. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 暗杀阴谋发生后，住院参议员在哥伦比亚民调中高居榜首
item.description: 上个月，反对党总统候选人米格尔-乌里韦（Miguel Uribe）遭遇未遂谋杀，哥伦比亚人团结起来支持他，将他推上了该国政治排行榜的首位。【原文：Colombians rallied behind opposition presidential candidate Miguel Uribe after an attempt on his life last month, propelling him to the top of the country’s political rankings.】

item.title: 中国 6 月汽车销量因补贴提高创历史新高
item.description: 随着天气转暖，6 月份通常是中国汽车销售的淡季，但上个月却一反常态，在主要城市暂停政府以旧换新补贴之前，买家纷纷寻求利用这一补贴，推动交易量创下新高。【原文：June is typically a slow period for car sales in China as the warmer weather kicks in but last month bucked that trend, with buyers seeking to take advantage of a government trade-in subsidy before it was suspended in key cities pushing transactions to a record.】

item.title: 开罗电信枢纽发生致命火灾造成大面积中断
item.description: 开罗市中心一家重要的电话交换中心发生大火，造成至少四人死亡，另有 27 人受伤，网络服务中断，当地证券交易所被迫取消周二的交易时段。【原文：A blaze at a key downtown Cairo telephone exchange left at least four people dead and another 27 injured, cutting off network services and forcing the local stock exchange to cancel Tuesday’s trading session.】

item.title: H2O America 接近 5.4 亿美元的德克萨斯州水务交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，H2O America 正在就收购竞争对手 Quadvest 供水和污水处理公司的资产进行深入谈判，这项交易将提升其在快速增长的得克萨斯州市场的影响力。【原文：H2O America is in advanced talks to buy the assets of rival water and wastewater utility Quadvest in a transaction that would boost its presence in the fast-growing Texas market, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 日本供应忧虑再起，国债随全球债券下跌
item.description: 美国国债下跌，受累于全球较长期限债券的抛售，因为市场担心日本可能会增加售债。【原文：US Treasuries fell, caught up in a global selloff of longer-maturity bonds as concern Japan may boost debt sales rippled across markets.】

item.title: 英国财政报告称，养老金购买减少，英国将面临 220 亿英镑的打击
item.description: 由于养老金计划购买的金边债券减少，英国面临着政府债务利息支出激增 220 亿英镑（299 亿美元）的风险，这使得英国严重依赖外国投资者抢购公共债务。【原文：Britain is at risk of a £22 billion ($29.9 billion) surge in the government’s debt-interest bill as pension schemes buy fewer gilts, making the country heavily dependent on foreign investors to snap up public debt.】

item.title: 亚马逊卖家抑制 Prime Day 折扣，关税带来冲击
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）的 "Prime Day "正在与唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的贸易战发生冲突，不断变化的关税促使一些品牌退出夏季促销活动，一些购物者也暗示他们计划退出。【原文：Amazon.com Inc.’s Prime Day is slamming into President Donald Trump’s trade war, with ever-shifting tariffs prompting some brands to sit out the summer sale and some shoppers dropping hints they plan to pull back.】

item.title: 特朗普税改法案出台前美国小型企业乐观情绪略有下降
item.description: 6 月份，美国小企业的信心略有下降，因为在特朗普政府赢得重大立法胜利之前，企业主继续担心税收问题。【原文：Sentiment among US small businesses fell slightly in June as owners continued to worry about taxes ahead of a major legislative win for the Trump administration.】

item.title: 支出激增，高盛、汇丰提示德国债券风险
item.description: 随着德国政府推动支出，债务供应增加，并支持经济增长，一些全球最大的银行对德国政府债券发出了新的警告。【原文：Some of the world’s biggest banks are sending fresh warnings on German government bonds as the country’s spending push drives up debt supply and supports economic growth.】

item.description:

item.title: Robinhood 与监管机构讨论代币化股票问题
item.description: Robinhood Markets Inc.首席执行官弗拉德-特涅夫（Vlad Tenev）表示，该公司正在就其在欧洲发行代币化股票一事与监管机构进行谈判，此前该产品的推出招致了包括 OpenAI 在内的公司的斥责。【原文：Robinhood Markets Inc. Chief Executive Officer Vlad Tenev said the firm is in talks with regulators over its offering of tokenized equities in Europe, after the launch drew rebuke from companies including OpenAI.】

item.title: S&P 500 指数 3 月份创纪录的赢家寥寥无几，这是一个警示信号
item.description: 与 S&P 500 指数同时创下新高的股票越来越少，这对担心市场日益集中于大型科技公司的交易商来说是一个不受欢迎的信号。【原文：Fewer stocks are setting new highs alongside the S&P 500 Index, an unwelcome sign for traders worried about the market’s increasing concentration in a cluster of massive technology companies.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德支持的风险投资部门启动信贷基金，寻求 8 亿美元投资
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，由布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）支持的风险基金管理公司 Pinegrove Capital Partners 正在为一支新的信贷基金筹集资金。【原文：Pinegrove Capital Partners, a manager of venture funds that’s backed by Brookfield Asset Management, is raising money for a new credit fund, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 印度报告自大流行病以来电力需求首次下降
item.description: 由于夏季凉爽，减少了能源密集型空调的使用，印度截至 6 月份的季度电力需求比去年同期下降了近 1.5%。【原文：India’s electricity demand in the quarter through June declined almost 1.5% from a year earlier, following a cooler summer that reduced the use of energy-intensive air conditioners.】

item.title: 米莱的秘密武器是《西厢记》的反清醒信徒
item.description:
圣地亚哥-卡普托（Santiago Caputo）正在颠覆阿根廷政坛，因为在关键的中期投票之前，他与自由主义者总统的妹妹传言关系紧张。

 

Santiago Caputo is upending Argentine politics amid rumored tension with the libertarian president’s sister ahead of a crucial midterm vote.

 

】

item.title: 迪拜创业公司为夜视隐形眼镜融资 2.5 亿美元
item.description: 一家由俄罗斯人和乌克兰人创办的迪拜初创公司筹集了 2.5 亿美元，用于开发可提供夜视、变焦功能和实时健康检查的智能隐形眼镜。【原文：A Dubai-based startup founded by a Russian and a Ukrainian raised $250 million to develop smart contact lenses that provide night vision, zoom capabilities and real-time health checks.】

item.title: 欧洲央行研究显示：欧盟与独裁者的贸易往来日益频繁
item.description: 根据欧洲中央银行发布的研究报告，在过去的四分之一世纪里，欧洲的贸易伙伴变得越来越不民主，这与各国政府关注政治、人权和社会权利的承诺背道而驰。【原文：Europe’s trading partners have become less democratic over the past quarter century, contrary to a commitment by governments to pay attention to political, human and social rights, according to research published by the European Central Bank.】

item.title: BAT 称南非因非法香烟损失 16 亿美元
item.description: 据一份新报告称，南非已成为世界上最大的非法香烟销售市场之一，每年因逃税损失约 280 亿兰特（16 亿美元）。【原文：South Africa has become one of the world’s biggest markets for illicit cigarette sales losing around 28 billion rand ($1.6 billion) a year to tax evasion, according to a new report.】

item.title: 瑞银集团多诺万称，特朗普可能通过推迟关税挽救圣诞节
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）首席经济学家保罗-多诺万（Paul Donovan）认为，唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）将关税上调时间推迟到 8 月 1 日，可能只是将关税上调时间推迟到 2026 年，从而减轻了对圣诞节的价格影响。【原文：Donald Trump’s delay of tariff increases until Aug. 1 may have just softened the price impact for Christmas by pushing it into 2026, according to UBS Group AG Chief Economist Paul Donovan.】

item.title: 台湾出口创历史新高加剧美国贸易紧张局势和货币风险
item.description: 在全球人工智能需求的推动下，台湾的出口一路高歌猛进，但这一繁荣景象正成为与华盛顿贸易关系的导火索，并给经济带来越来越大的风险。【原文：Taiwan’s exports are on a tear, powered by global demand for artificial intelligence — but the boom is becoming a flashpoint in trade relations with Washington and a growing risk for the economy.】

item.title: Danantara 委任四家银行牵头提供高达 100 亿美元的贷款
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印尼主权财富基金达纳塔拉公司（Danantara）指定四家银行协调一笔多达 100 亿美元的多币种借款，这可能是东南亚最大的一笔贷款。【原文：Indonesian sovereign wealth fund Danantara appointed four banks to coordinate a multicurrency borrowing of as much as $10 billion, in what could be Southeast Asia’s largest loan, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 扩张称 BBVA 削减了萨瓦德尔交易的预期节余
item.description: 据《Expansion》报道，在西班牙政府数年阻止全面合并之后，BBVA SA 已经削减了内部对可能收购萨瓦德尔银行（Banco Sabadell SA）所带来的节约和收益的估计。【原文：BBVA SA has trimmed internal estimates of savings and benefits from a potential takeover of Banco Sabadell SA, Expansion reported, after the Spanish government blocked a full merger for several years.】
